ASANTE QUEEN MOTHERS: PRECOLONIAL AUTHORITY IN A POSTCOLONIAL SOCIETY
summary: While the Asantehene and the Asantehemmaa are well known figures in Ghana, less familiar are the many queen mothers who function in paral1el roles to chiefs in every Asante town and paramountcy. Ignored by the British and general1y bypassed by modem Ghanaian leaders, queen mothers have nevertheless continued to serve their constituencies faithfully. More recently, however, globalization has discovered them, and external sources are beginning to seek them out for local projects. Yet, queen mothers continue 1:0face serious obstacles as a precolonial female authority in a postcolonial society. Resume Bien que Ie Roi et la Reine des Asante soient tres connus au Ghana, la plupart des Reines-meres qui jouent parallelement les roles de chefs dans taus les milieux Asante 50nt moins reconnues. En depit du fait qu'elles sont ignorees par les Britaniques et non reconnues en general par les leaders ghaneens actuels, les Reines-meres continuent de servir loyalement leurs chefferies. Cependant, Ie concept de la mondialisation a tre~) recemment permis de Ies redecouvrir. C'est ainsi que des organisations etrangeres commencent ales reperer pour des projets locaux. Apres tout, les Reines-meres font toujours face a de serieux problemes par Ie fait qu'elles constituent un pouvoir feminin precolonial dans une socie'~e postcoloniale.

title: MOTHERWIFEARTIST -WHAT DO THE CHANGES IN THE VISUALIZATION OF MATERNITY IN THE OEUVRE OF LOUISE BOURGEOIS REVEAL ABOUT HER AND THE ROLE OF WOMEN ARTISTS IN THE 20TH CENTURY
summary:
Simone de Beauvoir holds up the image of the mirror as the key to feminine condition. She states
that women concern themselves with their own images, men with an enlarged self-image provided by their
reflection in a woman. If this holds true, the oeuvre of French-American artist Louise Bourgeois who,
especially in her late works, constantly used mirrors to force the viewer to consider himself is from great
interest as it should reveal realities about the life of a woman artist in the 20th century. Bourgeois constantly
„mirrored“ her life through her art. In her personal iconography the mirror represents “the acceptance of the
self.“ As a woman artist in a cultural sector that, especially at the beginning of her career, 1 was dominated by
male American artists, she strongly believed in her femininity as source of inspiration. Interestingly this male
dominance especially in the 1950s and 1960s was driven by women. Many art patrons were female.
Moreover the majority of galleries in the 57th were run by women dealers like Peggy Guggenheim or Marion
Willard. These powerful women created an establishment that favored charming male artists.2 Some even
had intimate relationships with their proteges. To be part of the art game, many woman artists divorced art
practice from female experience in order to succeed professionally. Louise Bourgeois mirrored her life
through her work covering intimate topics and episodes in her seven decades spanning oeuvre.3 As the
century progressed, her works changed in style, material and size but one theme stayed relevant and
essential throughout her entire corpus: Maternity. These works that address fertility, conception, pregnancy,
giving birth and motherhood reflect the personal narrative of her identity as artist, wife and mother. If we
consider Simone de Beauvoir’s idea, what reflection of herself and her role as woman artist did Louise
Bourgeois create with her recurrent yet changing visualization of maternity throughout her seven decades
spanning oeuvre? The essay discusses five of these maternity related works in detail with the aim to peel of
the inner soul of the work in relation to her personal situation and the overall political, intellectual situation of
woman artists at certain decades. I will concentrate my analysis on the changing roles of Louise Bourgeois
throughout her artistic career — from ArtistMother, to ArtistWife, to aging artist. These three episodes are
central to her life as they mark the beginning (moment of birth and origin), the continuity (exfoliation of the
beginning) and late period (decay of the body) of her artist life and the life of a woman artist in general.4

title: Medya ve Toplumsal Cinsiyet
summary:
Toplumsal cinsiyet çalışmaları açısından bir kılavuz niteliğindeki Toplumsal Cinsiyet Tartışmaları, toplumsal cinsiyet kavramını ve olgusunu çeşitli disiplinlerin ilişkisi ve etkileşimi üzerinden irdeliyor.
Toplumsal cinsiyet rollerinin oluşumu ve bu rollerin bedenle olan ilişkisi, tarih, edebiyat, felsefe, emek, kalkınma, sosyal politika ve kent politikası alanlarına etkileri bu kitapta ayrıntıyla tartışılan konular. Ayrıca siyaset ve medyaya yansıması ele alınarak toplumsal cinsiyeti anlamak için vazgeçilmez kaynaklar olan Queer Teori ve Eleştirel Erkeklik Çalışmaları gözden geçiriliyor. Erkek egemen sistem yapısı olan patriyarkanın belirginleştiği en somut yer olan erkek şiddeti bu kitapta tartışılan başlıklardan bir diğeri. Ufuk ve zihin açan alanlar olarak feminist yöntem ile feminist örgütlenme deneyimleri üzerinde de önemle duruluyor.
Kolektif bir emeğin ürünü olan Toplumsal Cinsiyet Tartışmaları bu alanda sorusu olanlar, merak edenler ve başka bir pencereden kendine bakmak isteyenler için bir başvuru kitabı denemesidir.

Un paradigma femenino de excelencia política. La Virgen María en la "Vita Christi" de sor Isabel de Villena (siglo XV)
summary:
One of the topics developed by the Clarissan abbess Isabel de Villena in her work "Vita Christi" was the politics. This text is framed in the cultural and political polemic known as "Querelle des Femmes" that was developed in the Late Middle Ages. The author vividly poses the issue "gender and sovereignty". She designs a complete political theory represented in a feminine paradigm: the Virgin is the theoretical and practical model of the “marvelous science” of human government. Strikingly, Mother Isabel offers this female model to any class of rulers, including men, who should look at themselves in that model, but especially those with institutional, secular or ecclesiastical, power. In order to develop these ideas, the Virgin is presented as the performer of the two main instances of power of that time embodying the functions of queen and female pope and offering a new basis to the “art of government” of the kingdoms and the Church. 
Uno de los temas desarrollados por la abadesa clarisa Isabel de Villena en su obra "Vita Christi" fue la política. Esta obra se enmarca en la polémica política y cultural conocida como "Querella de las Mujeres", que se desarrolló en la Baja Edad Media. La autora plantea vívidamente el tema "género y soberanía". Diseña una teoría política completa encarnada en un paradigma femenino: la Virgen es el modelo teórico y práctico de la "ciencia maravillosa" del gobierno humano. Sorprendentemente, la madre Isabel ofrece este modelo femenino a cualquier clase de gobernantes, incluidos los hombres, que se deben mirar en él, pero especialmente aquellos con poder institucional, secular o eclesiástico. Para desarrollar estas ideas, la Virgen se presenta como la titular de las dos principales instancias de poder de aquel tiempo encarnando las funciones de reina y papisa y ofreciendo  un nuevo fundamento al "arte del gobierno" de los reinos y la Iglesia

Women and Shari'ah: a critical vision of feminine identity in 'A Thousand Splendid Suns'
summary: Women's rights and liberties have suffered an unstable evolution in Middle East countries for centuries. Through the eyes of two women, Khaled Hosseini's A Thousand Splendid Suns explores almost forty years of the history of Afghanistan and delves into the loss of women's privileges. This essay aims to give a critical vision of the novel and to contrast historical periods and women's rights. Thus, using gender criticism to analyse the ideas and development of both main characters and a sociological approach to explore the historical periods and moments of upheaval the paper will try to establish how the identity of the woman is getting lost where fundamentalism reigns.

Keterlibatan perempuan dalam aksi terorisme dibuktikan dengankesamaan faktor, motivasi, dan tingkatan komitmen. Terdapat pergeseran peran sosial perempuan, yaitu terlibatnya perempuan dalam aktivitas yang maskulin seperti terorisme. Feminitas perempuan termanfaatkan dan disalahgunakan oleh laki-laki untuk dilibatkan dalam aktivitas menyangkut terorisme yang dijalaninya. title: India’s Search for an Optimal Coastal Security Organisation Arushi Painuly
summary:
Towards the overall national objective of attaining economic, material and societal wellbeing of its citizens, India’s national policy for development is steadily expanding from its continental confines to the maritime domain. This is amply clear from inter alia the national plans for port- led development (Sagarmala), NMDA (National Maritime Domain Awareness Project), which aims to cover the gaps in Static Surveillance, and the present government’s vision of SAGAR (Security And Growth for All in the Region).
In modern post-independence times, Indian coasts were facilitating areas for sea bound smuggling. The insatiable Indian demand for gold and electronics emboldened the underworld of Mumbai to grow into smuggling cartels, which finally played a major role in the execution of 26/11. Another important factor that needs to be considered by the Indian security establishment is the adversarial potential in its bilateral relations with China, and the growing Chinese military ‘footprint’ in the Indian Ocean. This has significant implications upon how India should develop its maritime security – including coastal security – mechanisms.
This paper examines India’s maritime security imperatives and the attendant evolution of its coastal security structure since the very beginning, based on the nation’s expanding maritime interests and the increasing security challenges. Against this backdrop, it aims to examine the options for India to develop an optimal Coastal Security Organisation for the coming years and decades.

research_interests.name: Coastal Security, Coast Guard, Marine Police

title: Ideal og praksis: tre københavnske borgerkvinders liv i slutningen af 1700-tallet
summary: This thesis considers the historiography of women within the field of bourgeois and 18th century history as a reproduction of male ideals of womanhood based mainly on prescriptive literature of the time. Rather than trying to find the real ideals or the real praxis of womanhood in the 18th century, this thesis uses three memoirs of bourgeois women, who lived in Copenhagen in the late 18th centu-ry, to show three distinct lives: Dorothea Biehl’s Mit ubetydelige Levnets Løb, Friederike Brun’s Wahrheit aus Morgenträumen & Idas ästhetische Entwickelung, and Sophie Thalbitzer’s Mine Bekiendelser. Through a close reading of the material based on a discourse analytical and gender constructivist framework the author concludes that no singular way of being woman existed at the time. Women were individuals, and not simply a homogenous and marginalized group.
